main.docTitle: Maximum Amount of Election Expenses (Rural Representative Election) Regulation

editorialNote.content: The title of this Regulation was amended from “Maximum Amount of Election Expenses (Village Representative Election) Regulation” to “Maximum Amount of Election Expenses (Rural Representative Election) Regulation” — see 5 of 2014 s. 60.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: election (選舉) means a rural ordinary election or a rural by-election respectively under section 20 or 21 of the Election Ordinance; (5 of 2014 s. 61)
Election Ordinance (《選舉條例》) means the Rural Representative Election Ordinance (Cap. 576); (5 of 2014 s. 61)
elector (選民), in relation to a Rural Area, means a person who is registered as an elector for the Rural Area in the final register for that Rural Area; (5 of 2014 s. 61)
final register (正式選民登記冊) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance;
rural by-election (鄉郊補選) and rural ordinary election (鄉郊一般選舉) have the meanings assigned to them by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance. (5 of 2014 s. 61)

section.name: s2
section.heading: Maximum amount of election expenses
section.leadIn: The maximum amount of election expenses that can be incurred by or on behalf of a candidate at an election for a Rural Area is— (5 of 2014 s. 62)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: where there are more than 1,000 electors but not more than 5,000 electors for the Rural Area, $28,000; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where there are over 5,000 electors for the Rural Area, $38,000. (5 of 2014 s. 62)
